  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL arg0, ResourceBundle arg1)
      Initializes the controller class.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      arg0 - The URL location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known.
      arg1 - The resources used to localize the root object, or null if the root object was not localized.

    • addMessage

      public void addMessage()
      The method introduce sending a message to chat or someone directly.

    • displayName

      public void displayName(String username)
      Displays the username and sets the online status to true.
      Parameters:
      username - The username to be displayed.

    • setUsername

      public void setUsername(String username)
      Sets the username for the current user.
      Parameters:
      username - The username to be set.

    • searchUser

      public void searchUser()
      Searches for a user based on the input search string. If a user is found, displays the user's information and avatar. If the user is already in the list, shows an error message. If the search string is empty, displays a message indicating no input was given.

    • addUser

      public void addUser() throws SQLException
      Adds the selected user to the list. If the user already exists in the list, it displays an error message.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if an SQL exception occurs during the database operation.

    • rejectUser

      public void rejectUser()
      Rejects the selected user. If the user does not exist in the list, it clears the label and hides certain elements. If the user already exists in the list, it displays an error message.

    • deleteUser

      public void deleteUser()
      Deletes the selected user from the list. If the user exists in the list, it removes the user, updates the list view, deletes the friend relationship, and hides certain elements. If the user is not found in the list, it displays an error message.
